Matching

Instructions: Match each line item below with its correct financial report. Select the Check Answers button to check your answers.

This is the answers table.
Income Statement Balance Sheet Cash Flow Statement
Accountant Fees Assets Beginning Cash Balance
Net Income* Equity End of Month Cash Balance
Program Supplies Expense Liabilities Net Change in Cash
Registration Fee Revenue Net Income*
Tuition Revenue

*Net income may be listed on both the income statement and balance sheet.

The best way to get more comfortable with each of these reports and the information contained in them is to continue your practice using them. It can be especially helpful to work on these reports with an experienced colleague or financial professional. Having more than one person checking these reports ensures greater accuracy and is an example of internal control to help reduce risk.
